Identification_Area.title: Viking Orbiter 1 Spacecraft Radio Science Subsystem

External_Reference.reference_text: Sjogren, W.L., Mars Gravity: High-resolution results from Viking Orbiter 2, Science, 203, 1006-1010, 1979.

Instrument.name: Viking Orbiter 1 Spacecraft Radio Science Subsystem
Instrument.description: The Viking Orbiter 1 Spacecraft (VO1) Radio Science Subsystem (RSS) was used to support the radio science investigation. This investigation utilized the radio signals to and from the spacecraft to obtain a variety of information. Transponders on the spacecraft send back signals that were coherent with those received from earth so that precision Doppler and ranging measurements could be made. The downlinks from the spacecraft included two coherent frequencies (S band and X band) so that dispersion in the interplanetary medium could be measured and corrected for. From analysis of the radio signals a surprising diversity of information could potentially be obtained and the Radio Science Team identified a large number of scientific objectives, which fell into three categories: dynamical, surface, and internal properties of Mars, atmospheric and ionospheric properties of Mars, and miscellaneuos solar system properties.
